elements.title: Rosalía Abreu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there was an initial agreement for chimpanzees from the private zoo of Rosalía Abreu (pictured) to be part of an experiment to breed a humanzee?

elements.title: True Love (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the cover art for "True Love" features handwritten notes by XXXTentacion?

elements.title: Paradise of Wisdom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Paradise of Wisdom, an early Islamic medical encyclopedia, describes an abortion-causing stone?

elements.title: Jon Brittenum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jon Brittenum managed an investment banking firm after his fourteen-game-long NFL career?

elements.title: accessible yoga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that accessible yoga was formed as a way for people with disabilities to be able to perform yoga?

elements.title: Corianton: A Story of Unholy Love (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the screenwriter for Corianton: A Story of Unholy Love went to jail for telling a judge to "shut up"?

elements.title: Elcho Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elcho Castle never saw combat, but was nearly burned down by a mob in 1773?

elements.title: Jordan Gray (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jordan Gray added the technical name for spider silk to her name due to the UK not having a process to change honorific from Mr to Miss?
